context_of_use: This use case allows patients to access permitted portions of their electronic medical records from different devices.
description: Allow patients to access permitted portions of their electronic medical records from different devices.
triggering_event: Patient requests to access their electronic medical record.
preconditions: Patient is authenticated in the system.
Patient has permissions to access their electronic medical record.
postconditions: Patient successfully views the permitted portions of their electronic medical record.
assumptions: The system has a mechanism to manage access control for patient records.
Patients have the necessary devices to access their records.
requirements_met: The system shall allow patients to access their electronic medical records.
The system shall ensure that only permitted portions of the records are accessible.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on which portions of the medical record are accessible to patients.
main_flow: 1. Patient requests to access their electronic medical record → System verifies patient authentication and permissions.
2. System retrieves permitted portions of the electronic medical record → System displays the electronic medical record to the patient.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the patient does not have the necessary permissions, then the system informs the patient that access is denied.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the patient authentication fails, then the system displays an error message and prompts for re-authentication.
